aboutBedouin.description: *We are the Bedouins of Farafra Oasis, the people and guardians of the White Desert.* We offer an experience that comes straight from the heart of the place itself. *For us, camping is a complete way of life, not just accommodation* — filled with simplicity, comfort, *and real adventure* in a nature we truly love and protect because it’s part of who we are.
aboutBedouin.quote: *Our experience in the White Desert spans more than 26 years* — we know its routes, seasons, and secrets by heart. Every trip we organize is built on real knowledge and authentic experience. *We’ve run the same programs thousands of times* with adventurers from different countries around the world.

firstTime.question: Is the trip suitable for me even if it's my first desert experience?
firstTime.answer: Yes. The trip is designed for beginners who are going to the desert for the first time, or for experienced adventurers. The program is gradual and prepared to make you enjoy it safely, with no prior experience required.

comfortable.question: Are the sleeping arrangements and facilities really comfortable?
comfortable.answer: Yes. We use high-quality tents, mattresses, sleeping bags, and blankets suitable for the desert's temperature, keeping you warm and comfortable. The Bedouins at Farafra Oasis provide immediate support if needed, so you can fully enjoy the White Desert experience.

bathroom.question: Are there bathrooms, or will it be difficult?
bathroom.answer: Farafra Camp has bathrooms and electricity. The desert camping setup ensures comfort and respects the environment, without being random or inconvenient.

food.question: What about the food?
food.answer: Food is an essential part of the experience, not an addition. 7 full meals, fresh and organic food, served on time, with herbal tea and hot drinks available throughout the day.

hiddenCosts.question: Are there any extra costs besides what's listed?
hiddenCosts.answer: No. Everything is included in the price: transportation, safari, camping, hotel, meals, activities, and reserve fees. There are no hidden charges. The only expenses to consider are personal purchases or gifts.

instructions.question: Instructions
instructions.answer:
• Pack light, bring essentials and personal items only
• Morning is warm, afternoon pleasant, and nights can be cold
• Wear comfortable clothes for movement and sand; don't forget your sunglasses and cap
• Shoes are more important than anything; flip-flops, Crocs, or sandals are fine
• Don't forget a flashlight or use your phone's flash and a power bank
• Also bring sunscreen and moisturizer
• If you love coffee, bring the coffee you like

day1.title: Day One – Friday
activities: 05:30 AM: Visit to El-Gara Cave (the strangest cave in Egypt)
09:00 AM: Arrival at Uzersaif Camp in Farafra Oasis + Egyptian breakfast (the camp is equipped with a bathroom and electricity)

10:00 AM: Departure by 4x4 safari vehicles to visit:

◦ Aqabat Valley
◦ Moon Cave
◦ Sandboarding
◦ Wadi Hennis

2:00 PM: Light lunch at Ain Khadra

◦ Moon Surface
◦ Wadi El-Mokhayamat

Famous rock formations:
The Mushroom – The Chicken – The Rabbit – The Horse – The Camel – The Sphinx
5:00 PM: At sunset: Camping setup – receiving tents and sleeping gear
9:00 PM: BBQ dinner with Bedouin marinade, then continue the evening under the stars with a campfire and Bedouin herbal tea

day2.title: Day Two – Saturday
activities: Sunrise + Bedouin breakfast in the heart of the desert
8:00 AM: Breaking camp and returning to Farafra Oasis
10:30 AM: Check into Bedouin hotel – 3 hours rest
2:00 PM: Head to UzerSaif Camp (light lunch)

*Today's attractions:*

◦ Farafra Palace
◦ Amina’s House
◦ Oasis Gardens
◦ Roman Springs
◦ Badr Abdel Moghny Museum (World Heritage)
9:00 PM: Bedouin mizmar party + Mandi dinner

day3.title: Day Three – Sunday
activities: 08:00 AM: Leave rooms + breakfast at UzerSaif Camp
11:45 AM: Tea session by the Roman springs
3:00 PM: Stop to buy oasis products

instructions.title: *Instructions*
items: Pack light - bring only *essentials and personal items*
Morning is *warm*, afternoon is *pleasant*, night gets *cold*
*Comfortable clothes* for movement and sand, don't forget your *sunglasses and cap*
Shoes are *the most important thing* - sandals, crocs, or flip-flops work
Don't forget a *flashlight* or use your phone flash & *power bank*
If you love *coffee*, bring your favorite beans
